definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To convert into a mash; to reduce to a soft pulpy state by beating or pressure
examples: We had fun mashing apples in a mill.
The potatoes need to be mashed .

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) In brewing, to convert (for example malt, or malt and meal) into the mash which makes wort , by mixing it with hot water.
( transitive , UK , chiefly Northern England ) To prepare a cup of tea in a teapot; to brew (tea).
( transitive , Southern US , informal ) To press. (Can we add an example for this sense?)
( transitive , informal , gaming ) To press (a button) rapidly and repeatedly .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To convert into a mash; to reduce to a soft pulpy state by beating or pressure

( transitive , Southern US , informal ) To press. (Can we add an example for this sense?)
( transitive , informal , gaming ) To press (a button) rapidly and repeatedly .

definitions.definition: To flirt , to make eyes , to make romantic advances.

main_definition: To flirt , to make eyes , to make romantic advances.
